newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH 1997 BUDGET GAP AT PLN 12.2 BLN - MINFIN.
newsitem.headline: POLISH 1997 BUDGET GAP AT PLN 12.2 BLN - MINFIN.

text.p: Poland's amended 1997 budget draft envisages the deficit of 12.2 billion zlotys or 2.8 percent of gross domestic product, the finance ministry said on Friday.
It said in a statement that after Finance Minister Grzegorz Kolodko amended the budget draft on Friday the spending level was set at 127.3 billion zlotys while revenues at 115.1 billion zlotys.
Kolodko earlier told a news conference that the resulting gap would be an equivalent of 2.8 percent of GDP.
The statement confirmed the draft envisaged lowering inflation in December next year to 13 percent from the current 19.5 percent.

Kolodko had to amend the budget draft to take into account a personal income tax cut approved by parliament on Thursday. His original budget draft proposal provided for a gap amounting to 2.6 percent of GDP.
Parliament has until January 28 to pass the budget.
